definition: silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: The utility model relates to a double filament fluorescent lamp and a lamp base.
sentences.chinese: 本實用新型是一種雙燈絲熒光燈管及管座。

sentences.english: If the filament transformer has a center tap, don't use it.
sentences.chinese: 如果變壓器燈絲繞組有抽頭，請不要使用它。

sentences.english: The principles discussed in this report are applicable to all filamentary cathode structures.
sentences.chinese: 而本文所討論的原理可以應用到各種類型的燈絲結構。

sentences.english: Hum produced from within the filamentary structure.
sentences.chinese: 燈絲結構本身所產生的HUM。

sentences.english: If you drop an incandescent bulb and break the filament, it’s done.
sentences.chinese: 如果你摔壞白熾燈的燈絲，它便無法使用了。

sentences.english: Why there is such a hing called "filament emmision"?
sentences.chinese: 燈絲爲什麼會發射電子？

sentences.english: Applied for making auto lamp filament and other anti-shock devices.
sentences.chinese: 用於製造汽車燈絲及其他要求高溫抗震性能好的零件。

sentences.english: It has no light bulb and filament. E27 socket for general use is easy to install and replace.
sentences.chinese: 無燈泡燈絲，E27標準通用型螺口，安裝更換便捷。

sentences.english: It is the current state of the filament heated to incandescence and is used to light the lamp.
sentences.chinese: 它是電流把燈絲加熱到白熾狀態而用來發光的燈。

sentences.english: Carbon conducts electricity, has a high resistance and can be shaped into thin filaments.
sentences.chinese: 碳導電，並且電阻值高，可以做成細燈絲。

definition: variant of 附會|附会[fu4 hui4]
